se.codeslasher.io

Class FileSplitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.codeslasher.io.FileSplitter

  • public class FileSplitter
extends java.lang.Object
    Splits a file into smaller files. Uses Path (Java NIO)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileSplitter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void splitFileByParts(java.nio.file.Path src, java.nio.file.Path dest, int parts, java.lang.String baseName, boolean deleteSrc)
      Splits a file into smaller parts based on number of parts and optionally deletes the source file after it's finished.
      static void splitFileBySize(java.nio.file.Path src, java.nio.file.Path dest, long bytesPerFile, java.lang.String baseName, boolean deleteSrc)
      Splits a file into smaller parts based on size and optionally deletes the source file after it's finished.

    • Method Detail

      • splitFileByParts

        public static void splitFileByParts(java.nio.file.Path src,
                                    java.nio.file.Path dest,
                                    int parts,
                                    java.lang.String baseName,
                                    boolean deleteSrc)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Splits a file into smaller parts based on number of parts and optionally deletes the source file after it's finished.
        Parameters:
        src - The Source file
        dest - The Destination Directory
        parts - How many parts to split the file in
        baseName - Base name for the smaller files
        deleteSrc - If the source file should be deleted after splitting it
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Can be that the destination isn't writeable, the source not readable

      • splitFileBySize

        public static void splitFileBySize(java.nio.file.Path src,
                                   java.nio.file.Path dest,
                                   long bytesPerFile,
                                   java.lang.String baseName,
                                   boolean deleteSrc)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Splits a file into smaller parts based on size and optionally deletes the source file after it's finished.
        Parameters:
        src - The Source file
        dest - The Destination Directory
        bytesPerFile - How many bytes a part should be
        baseName - Base name for the smaller files
        deleteSrc - If the source file should be deleted after splitting it
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Can be that the destination isn't writeable, the source not readable
